title: 103_hr5054
content: SEC. 2. EQUAL TREATMENT OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS WITH FEDERAL EMPLOYEES GENERALLY UNDER CSRS. Section 8332 is amended by removing subsections (d) and (h). Section 8334 is amended to adjust deductions from employee pay based on their position. From August 1, 1920, to December 31, 1994, there was a gradual increase in congressional employee service from 2.5 years to 7 years. From July 1, 1926, to December 31, 1994, congressional employee service increased gradually from 3.5 years to 7 years, with different periods of service specified. The amendments to retirement sections include removing subsections, inserting "or Member" after "employee," and adjusting the computation of annuity. The retirement sections are amended by removing subsections, adjusting annuity computations, and inserting "or Member" after "employee." SEC. 3. EQUAL TREATMENT OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS WITH FEDERAL EMPLOYEES UNDER FERS. Section 8412 is amended by removing subsection (f). Section 8415 is amended to include "or Member" after "employee" in subsections (a) and (e), remove subsections (b) and (c), adjust subsection (f)(2)(A), and remove "Congressional employee" from subsection (g)(2). Section 8421(a)(2) is amended by removing "section 8412(f), or under". Section 8422 is amended to include "or Member" after "employee" in subsection (a)(2)(A). In subsection (e), government contributions are amended to include "Members" after "employees" and to remove references to "Members, Congressional employees." SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act will be effective on January 1, 1995, and applies to individuals serving as Members of Congress or congressional employees before and after that date. An annuity for service before January 1, 1995, will be determined based on the laws in effect on December 31, 1994. Members of Congress or congressional employees can choose to be covered under the reformed system. Members of Congress or congressional employees can elect to treat service before January 1, 1995, as service under the applicable chapter as if the amendments made by this Act were in effect during that time. The terms "Member of Congress" and "congressional employee" are defined in sections 2106 and 2107 of title 5, United States Code.
